intro: Malveopsis aretioides, commonly known as the African velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in disturbed soils. Malveopsis aretioides is also noted for its ability to grow in a variety of soil types, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
